location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.440 of 1855 from Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter, enclosing a letter from Captain Arnold Kemball, Political Agent in Turkish Arabia, to Jones, dated 18 October 1855, itself a covering letter, with a letter sent by Lord Stratford de Redcliffe, British Ambassador in Constantinople, to Kemball, dated 19 September 1855. Lord Stratford’s letter commends Jones’s actions (in his previous capacity as Political Agent in Turkish Arabia) in helping save and recover antiquities damaged on their journey from Mosul to Bussorah [Basra].
